text.text_translated:
"The Hunger Games" is a very popular book for young people. An American writer named Suzanne Collins wrote it. The book came out in 2008.
You can now read the book in 26 different languages. Millions of people around the world bought it. It was the first book for young people to sell more than a million electronic copies. An electronic copy is a book you read on a computer.
Now, "The Hunger Games" is also a big Hollywood movie. The movie is very popular too. In its first weekend, it made 152.5 million dollars. That was only in North America.

- Vocabulary Control: Vocabulary is strictly confined to the A2 level. The potentially complex term 'electronic copy' was correctly identified and immediately defined using simple A1/A2 vocabulary ('a book you read on a computer'). This is exemplary.
